alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Grady; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:55AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washita, northwestern Grady, northern Caddo, Custer, southwestern Blaine and Canadian Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 455 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Geary to 4 miles southwest of Calumet to 7 miles northeast of Cogar to near Lookeba to 4 miles west of Eakly. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Reno, Weatherford, Clinton, Cordell, Yukon, Mustang, Tuttle, Hinton, Union City, Minco, Geary, Hydro, Arapaho, Binger, Hammon, Calumet, Corn, Custer City, Eakly and Butler. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 54 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Grady; Washita
